text.text: Here's a summary of Bolt for Python in table format:
*Bolt for Python Summary*
*Basic Information*

rows.text: Python framework to build Slack apps quickly

text.text: *App Modes*

*1.*
‣ *Mode*: HTTP Mode
‣ *Class*: App
‣ *Use Case*: Standard web server
‣ *Requirements*: SLACK_SIGNING_SECRET, SLACK_BOT_TOKEN, ngrok

*2.*
‣ *Mode*: Socket Mode
‣ *Class*: App + SocketModeHandler
‣ *Use Case*: No public URL needed
‣ *Requirements*: SLACK_APP_TOKEN, SLACK_BOT_TOKEN

*3.*
‣ *Mode*: Async Mode
‣ *Class*: AsyncApp
‣ *Use Case*: Async/await pattern
‣ *Requirements*: aiohttp library
*Event Listener Methods*

*1.*
‣ *Method*: app.action(action_id)
‣ *Purpose*: Block Kit element interactions
‣ *Example Use Case*: Button clicks, select menus, date pickers

*2.*
‣ *Method*: app.command(command_name)
‣ *Purpose*: Slash commands
‣ *Example Use Case*: /hello-bot commands

*3.*
‣ *Method*: app.event(event_type)
‣ *Purpose*: Events API events
‣ *Example Use Case*: Message posted, user joined

*4.*
‣ *Method*: app.message([pattern])
‣ *Purpose*: Message events
‣ *Example Use Case*: Listen for specific message patterns

*5.*
‣ *Method*: app.shortcut(callback_id)
‣ *Purpose*: Global/message shortcuts
‣ *Example Use Case*: Quick actions from Slack UI

*6.*
‣ *Method*: app.view(callback_id)
‣ *Purpose*: Modal submissions
‣ *Example Use Case*: Form submissions

*7.*
‣ *Method*: app.function(callback_id)
‣ *Purpose*: Custom workflow steps
‣ *Example Use Case*: Workflow automation

*8.*
‣ *Method*: app.options(action_id)
‣ *Purpose*: External data sources
‣ *Example Use Case*: Dynamic select menu options
*Listener Function Arguments*

*1.*
‣ *Argument*: body
‣ *Type*: dict
‣ *Description*: Complete request body
‣ *Available For*: All events

*2.*
‣ *Argument*: payload
‣ *Type*: dict
‣ *Description*: Core event data
‣ *Available For*: All events

*3.*
‣ *Argument*: context
‣ *Type*: dict
‣ *Description*: Event context (botId, etc.)
‣ *Available For*: All events

*4.*
‣ *Argument*: ack
‣ *Type*: function
‣ *Description*: Acknowledge event receipt (required)
‣ *Available For*: Actions, shortcuts, views, commands, options

*5.*
‣ *Argument*: say
‣ *Type*: function
‣ *Description*: Send message to channel
‣ *Available For*: Events with channel_id

*6.*
‣ *Argument*: respond
‣ *Type*: function
‣ *Description*: Respond to event
‣ *Available For*: Events with response_url

*7.*
‣ *Argument*: client
‣ *Type*: Web API client
‣ *Description*: Make API calls
‣ *Available For*: All events

*8.*
‣ *Argument*: logger
‣ *Type*: Logger
‣ *Description*: Python logging instance
‣ *Available For*: All events

*9.*
‣ *Argument*: complete
‣ *Type*: function
‣ *Description*: Signal workflow step success
‣ *Available For*: Custom workflow steps

*10.*
‣ *Argument*: fail
‣ *Type*: function
‣ *Description*: Signal workflow step failure
‣ *Available For*: Custom workflow steps
*Environment Variables*

*1.*
‣ *Variable*: SLACK_BOT_TOKEN
‣ *Format*: xoxb-***
‣ *Required For*: All modes
‣ *Purpose*: Bot authentication

*2.*
‣ *Variable*: SLACK_SIGNING_SECRET
‣ *Format*: ***
‣ *Required For*: HTTP mode only
‣ *Purpose*: Request verification

*3.*
‣ *Variable*: SLACK_APP_TOKEN
‣ *Format*: xapp-***
‣ *Required For*: Socket mode only
‣ *Purpose*: WebSocket connection
*Resources*

*1.*
‣ *Resource*: Documentation
‣ *URL*: https://docs.slack.dev/tools/bolt-python/

*2.*
‣ *Resource*: Code Examples

‣ *Resource*: API Reference
